```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(readr)
millions <- read_csv("C:/Users/Qiong Fu/compstats/econometrics-growth/millions.csv")

require(dplyr)
millions <- select(millions, Country, gr56092, gdpsh60l, lifee060, p60)
names(millions) <- c('Country', 'growth', 'gdp', 'life', 'primary')

```

```{r}
summary(millions)
sd(millions$growth)
sd(millions$gdp)
sd(millions$life)
sd(millions$primary)

require(ggplot2)
ggplot(data = millions, aes(x=growth)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = .002) + labs(title = 'Distribution of Growth Rates', x='Growth Rate, 1960-1992')
ggsave("growth_rate_histogram.jpg")
ggplot(data = millions, aes(x=gdp)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = .1) + labs(title = 'Distribution of GDP per capita', x='log(GDP per capita), 1960')
ggsave("gdp_histogram.jpg")
ggplot(data = millions, aes(x=life)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = 1) + labs(title = 'Distribution of life expectancy', x='Life Expectancy')
ggsave("life_expectancy_histogram.jpg")
ggplot(data = millions, aes(x=primary)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = .02) + labs(title = 'Distribution of Primary School Enrollment Rates', x = 'Primary School Enrollment Rate')
ggsave("primary_school_histogram.jpg")

library(moments)
skewness(millions$growth)
kurtosis(millions$growth)
skewness(millions$gdp)
kurtosis(millions$gdp)
skewness(millions$life)
kurtosis(millions$life)
skewness(millions$primary)
kurtosis(millions$primary)

```

```{r}
summary(lm(growth~gdp+life+primary, data = millions))

```
